adventure_overview: The Bobcat Adventure is the first required Adventure on the trail to earn the Webelos badge of rank.  Once the Bobcat Adventure is completed, Webelos can start any other of the Adventures in any order. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America’s SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Get to know members of your den.

activities.name: Den Doodle Webelos
activities.description: Cub Scouts make a den doodle to help get to know their den members.

activities.name: Den Flag Webelos
activities.description: Cub Scouts make a den flag that shows something about each member.

activities.name: Hula Hoop Pass
activities.description: Cub Scouts play the Hula Hoop Pass game to learn about teamwork.

activities.name: Silent Line Up
activities.description: In this activity, Cub Scouts will learn some facts about each other without saying a word.

requirements.text: Recite the Scout Oath and the Scout Law with your den and den leader.  Describe the three points of the Scout Oath.

activities.name: Recite the Oath and Law Webelos
activities.description: In this activity, Cub Scouts recite the Scout Oath and Scout Law and learn about the three points of the Scout Oath.

activities.name: Scout Law Detective
activities.description: The points of the Scout Law are reinforced to Cub Scouts while they try to determine which point is missing.

activities.name: Scout Law Impersonation Game
activities.description: Cub Scouts impersonate points of the Scout Law then try to guess who was impersonating each point.

activities.name: Scout Law Relay
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about the Scout Law in this fun relay race.

requirements.text: With your den create a den Code of Conduct.

activities.name: Code of Conduct Webelos
activities.description: Cub Scouts will be invested in their own conduct when they help create their den Code of Conduct.

requirements.text: Learn about the denner position and responsibilities.

activities.name: Lead Opening and Closing Ceremonies
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn how to lead opening and closing ceremonies.

activities.name: What Does a Denner Do?
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about the denner’s responsibilities by making a list.

activities.name: Who’s the Denner?
activities.description: Cub Scouts prepare a calendar of the dates that each person will serve as the denner.

requirements.text: Demonstrate the Cub Scout sign, Cub Scout salute and Cub Scout handshake.  Show how each is used.

activities.name: Roll a Cub Scout Fundamental
activities.description: Cub Scouts demonstrate the Cub Scout sign, salute, and handshake.

activities.name: Teach the Cub Scout Sign, Salute, and Handshake
activities.description: Cub Scouts help younger Cub Scouts learn the Cub Scout sign, salute, and handshake.

activities.name: Using Cub Scout Fundamentals
activities.description: Cub Scouts use the Cub Scout sign, salute, and handshake while leading an opening and closing ceremony.

requirements.text: At home, with your parent or legal guardian do the activities in the booklet “How to Protect Your Children from Child Abuse: A Parent’s Guide.”

activities.name: Child Abuse Protection Review Webelos
activities.description: Review the activities in the booklet “How to Protect Your Children from Child Abuse: A Parent’s Guide.”
